title: [Capstone] how does capstone paper publishing work?
content: I have seen linkedin posts where seniors are going abroad for conferences. Does college really pay for that? How to publish, how to know which conferences to publish in? Which conferences fetches us S and A grade? Can a senior, graduate please give me insights on this?

comments.body:
College pay for the publication fees and if it is an international conference college gives you some part of travel expenses as well to attend that conference but not for domestic , if you want a S and A grade you are supposed to publish in an ieee conference and which has good scopus index 

This was how it worked when I was in final year don‚Äôt know if anything has been changed
They reimburse the conference fees for one author, travel fees are not reimbursed. If you have the option to present virtually, you're expected to take it.

If you want an S grade, conferences should be 10th edition and above or published in a journal.

If you want an A grade, I believe you need to have published in a 5th to 10th edition conference. 

B is 1st to 5th. 

C is if you don't publish. Its the lowest grade you can get.
So even if you don't come with something working at the end of 4th year, you would still end up completing the credits and getting the degree?
How difficult is it to get an S or A in the final sem? Also how many people actually travel to present projects in conferences?

Depends on the quality of work done. If you've done quality research and have good results, it won't be difficult to find a venue to present at. Of course, that means it's entirely on how much effort you put into the project. 

I wouldn't say *many* travel, but definitely quite a few. Most end up taking the virtual presentation option though.
Why theoretically? Any chance credits are withheld? Can any guide take any decision other than giving low grades like C or D?
Nope, the process is pretty objective. They ask you for the paper acceptance, you show them the acceptance letter and you get the grade. No scope of  bias
Is it compulsory to publish papers in conferences or can we also look at journals as an option?

Journals give you a direct S grade. They are an option but considering Capstone timelines, conferences are almost always the smarter option. You would have to wait much longer for a journal acceptance.
Oh okay thanks for letting me know!
